Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Beloved \Be*lov"ed\, n. One greatly loved. [1913 Webster]
My beloved is mine, and I am his. --Cant. ii. 16. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Belove \Be*love"\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Beloved}.] [OE. bilufien. See pref. {Be-}, and {Love}, v. t.] To love. [Obs.] --Wodroephe. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Beloved \Be*loved"\, p. p. & a. Greatly loved; dear to the heart. [1913 Webster]
Antony, so well beloved of C[ae]sar. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
This is my beloved Son. --Matt. iii. 17. [1913 Webster]
beloved adj : dearly loved [syn: {darling}, {dear}] n : a beloved person; used as terms of endearment [syn: {dear}, {dearest}, {loved one}, {honey}, {love}]
